{{also|dorf}} {{wikipedia}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|dorf}}, from {{inh|de|goh|dorf}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*þurpą}}, akin to Old Saxon ''[[thorp]]''. Compare {{cog|en|troop}} and archaic English {{m|en|thorp}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/dɔrf/|[dɔɐ̯f]|[dɔrf]}} * {{audio|de|De-Dorf.OGG|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|ɔʁf}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Dorfes|gen2=Dorfs|Dörfer|Dörfchen|dim2=Dörflein}} # [[village]] {{gloss|rural habitation of size between a hamlet and a town}} #* '''1903''', {{w|Fanny zu Reventlow}}, ''[[s:de:Ellen Olestjerne|Ellen Olestjerne]]'', in ''Franziska Gräfin zu Reventlow: Gesammelte Werke'', Albert Langen, page 551: #*: Vor ihnen lag das '''Dorf''' mit seinen Strohdächern und dem niedrigen, stumpfen Kirchturm. #*:: In front of them was the '''village''' with its thatched roofs and the small, flat church steeple. # {{lb|de|figurative}} [[backwater]] {{gloss|remote place; somewhere that remains unaffected by new events, progresses, ideas, etc.}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|(e)s|pl=Dörfer}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|böhmische Dörfer}} * {{l|de|Bundesdorf}} * {{l|de|Dorfanger}} * {{l|de|Dorffest}} * {{l|de|Dorfmitte}} * {{l|de|Dorfplatz}} * {{l|de|Dorftratsch}} * {{l|de|Dorfältester}} * {{l|de|dörflich}} * {{l|de|die Kirche im Dorf lassen}} * {{l|de|Kirchendorf}} * {{l|de|Kuhdorf}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|Runddorf}} * {{l|de|Rundlingsdorf}} (= {{l|de|Rundling}}) * {{l|de|Straßendorf}} * {{l|de|über die Dörfer}} {{der-bottom}} ====See also==== * {{l|de|Gemeinde|g=f}} * {{l|de|Kaff|g=n}} * {{l|de|Stadt|g=f}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
